title.narrative: The 13th replenishment of the African Development Fund (ADF-13)

description.narrative: Its strategic and operational priorities are aligned with those of the African Development Bank Group's Ten Year Strategy for 2013-2022, which two overall objectives are inclusive growth and green growth. The Strategy determines the ADF's strategic selectivity and operational focus on infrastructure, regional integration, private sector development, governance and accountability, and skills and technology; with three areas of special emphasis namely fragile states, food security and agriculture, and gender equality. These objectives fall well in line with overall Danish development priorities. The total ADF13 replenishment amounts to DKK 45.7 billion for 2014 to 2016, while the total Danish contribution in this time period is DKK 630 million; DKK 90 million in 2014, DKK 260 million in 2015 and DKK 280 million in 2016.

title.narrative:
African Development Effectiveness Review (ADER) is publicised yearly and reviews the status on the banks achievements in relation to it's targets within the five strategic main areas of operation.
Latest version of the report for 2016: https://www.afdb.org/fileadmin/uploads/afdb/Documents/Development_Effectiveness_Review_2016/ADER__2016_EN.pdf
